9. Teamwork: Teamwork is a critical component of a designer's work, as design projects often involve collaboration with other professionals such as developers, project managers, and other designers. A designer who is a strong team player is able to work effectively with others to achieve a common goal.

One important aspect of teamwork in the design industry is communication. A designer who is a strong team player is able to clearly communicate their ideas and feedback, as well as listen to and consider the ideas and feedback of others. This can lead to more creative and effective designs as a result of a collaborative design process.

Another aspect of teamwork is the ability to work effectively with individuals with different skill sets and backgrounds. A designer who is a team player is able to effectively communicate with developers, project managers, and other professionals to ensure that everyone is working towards a common goal.

In addition, a designer who is a strong team player is able to handle constructive criticism and feedback, and use it to improve their designs. This shows a willingness to learn and grow, and a dedication to creating high-quality designs.

Overall, being a strong team player is an important quality for a designer to possess in order to succeed in the design industry. (Source: "The Importance of Teamwork in Design" by AIGA, "The Importance of Communication in Teamwork" by Forbes)
